moves.2... Nc6: This is a bad move as it loses tempo.
moves.4... Nc4 5. Bxc4 dxc4 6. Nf3 Bg4: This is where I feel the loss of my white bishop.
moves.7. h3 Bh5 8. d3 cxd3 9. cxd3: I like this position. My bishop has a clean line to operate.
moves.9... Bxf3: He should have maintained the pin but he realized the queen was overworked. If Qxf3 then 10..., Qxd3
moves.10. gxf3: My king side is looking very dubious.
moves.10... e6 11. Qe2: Serves two purposes: 1 - to protect the pawn at b5 and it clears a square for the development of my knight.
moves.12... b6 13. Nc3 Be7 14. Rd1: Putting some pressure down the central file.
moves.14... O-O 15. Ne4 Nxe4 16. fxe4: I thought long on this move. I wasn't sure if I should have taken with the e pawn as that would have forced a queen move. I also thought it would have exposed my king more. By this time I had no intentions of castling.
moves.16... a5 17. h4 Bxh4: This was the blunder that should have lost the game. But as you'll see, I finished this game in spectacularly bad fashion.
moves.19. Ke2: Here's where the mirages start. I should have taken the bishop. I think R*h4 (threatening mate) then after gxh4 I go Qg4  and I think mate in one, right?
moves.21... Rxf2+: For my first game on GameKnot, I really had a good time. It's always painful to lose won games, but I have to chalk this up as a learning experience.
